reviews.name: Trevor O'Hagan
reviews.text: If you are looking for a fun, interesting experience, look no further than the ice bar. Located right near the Charles bridge and beside the Robot Club, it‚Äôs a small but entertaining space. For a small entrance fee (200 Kc or about ‚Ç¨7.85) you get access for 20 minutes, as well as a free drink. I‚Äôd recommend buying online using your card, or with Kc at the entrance. Extra drinks can be bought inside for 150 Kc. The place is quite small, although there are three or four areas that are perfect for a good photo op. My recommendation? Brave the cold for a second and take off your jacket for a hilariously out of place photo. Enjoy your time there!

reviews.name: Mete Arslancik
reviews.text: ƒ∞n the centre of Prague. 200 czk for one person, a drink inside is included the price. They give you gloves and special wear for cold. Everything inside is made of ice, including your drinking glass. You stay there for fifteen minutes. Once in  a lifetime experience.

reviews.name: Michael Stroehlein
reviews.text:
CLOSED! 
We bought a voucher via booking.com - on February 25th the ice pub was closed. The entrance could not to be found. At the exit there was a sign "closed for renovation", at the bar next door that was confirmed by the bartender. Nevertheless, you can continue buying vouchers via Ice Pub homepage and also e.g. through booking.com and waste money with this. BIG SCAM!
If you want to visit that paid for your ticket at the Ice Pub!

reviews.name: Ian Radcliffe
reviews.text: Good value for money with a drink included in an ice glass. Plenty of photo opportunities in ice thrones etc. Time in the ice pub is 20 minutes. Thermal Poncho and gloves supplied.

reviews.name: Alexandra Rivers
reviews.text: very cool staff at this place. very chill atmosphere and cool music. I would definitely go there again.

reviews.name: Ally Kinsey
reviews.text: Such a scam. Got convinced to go because it was a ‚Äúcool unique experience‚Äù despite being a short experience. Showed up and got told we had to wait around 15 more minutes before we were even allowed inside then once we were inside we had to pay to hang out in the robot bar while we waited another 20 minutes for the next session in the ice pub to start then got told on top of all of that we had to pay ANOTHER admissions fee for the ice bar even though that‚Äôs what we originally asked for and we even got told paying admissions earlier would cover both experiences. Such bs never even went inside. Also the dude working the front counter acted super annoyed with us the entire time as if we were the problem for being there and it wasn‚Äôt his entire job to help us.

reviews.name: Jesus Solero
reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) This curious pub is accessed by a covered gallery that is next to the Charles Bridge. It is permanently kept at -7¬∫ and everything inside is made of ice: the bar, a pair of thrones, the golem, the astronomical clock, a showcase with jewels and little else. The site is small and the time of stay is limited; the price of the ticket is 200 crowns (about ‚Ç¨ 8), and allows a stay of 20 minutes, which really become less, since while you put on the poncho and the gloves with which you enter the pub passes some weather. When we entered already equipped, the reverse timer already marked 15 minutes. A glass of vodka alone or with some fruit juice is included with the ticket, and the holders of the Prague Card have a second free glass. The containers are ice but very small, really something more than a shot. And little more, if you want to live a curious experience, go cold and drop 8 euros, it's fine, but if we don't want to live it, we haven't missed anything from the other world either.

(Original)
A este curioso pub se accede por una galer√≠a cubierta que se encuentra junto al Puente de Carlos. Se mantiene permanentemente a -7¬∫ y todo lo que hay en su interior est√° hecho de hielo: la barra, un par de tronos, el golem, el reloj astron√≥mico, una vitrina con joyas y poco m√°s. El sitio es peque√±o y el tiempo de estancia es limitado; el precio de la entrada es de 200 coronas (unos 8 ‚Ç¨), y permite una estancia de 20 minutos, que realmente se convierten en menos, ya que mientras uno se pone el poncho y los guantes con los que se entra al pub pasa alg√∫n tiempo. Cuando nosotros entramos ya equipados, el cron√≥metro de marcha atr√°s ya marcaba 15 minutos. Con la entrada est√° incluida una copa de vodka solo o con alg√∫n zumo de frutas, y los poseedores de la Prague Card tienen una segunda copa gratis. Los recipientes son de hielo pero muy peque√±os, realmente algo m√°s de un chupito. Y poco m√°s, si se quiere vivir una experiencia curiosa, pasar fr√≠o y soltar 8 euros, est√° bien, pero si no queremos vivirla tampoco nos hemos perdido nada del otro mundo.

reviews.name: Trevor O'Hagan
reviews.text: If you are looking for a fun, interesting experience, look no further than the ice bar. Located right near the Charles bridge and beside the Robot Club, it‚Äôs a small but entertaining space. For a small entrance fee (200 Kc or about ‚Ç¨7.85) you get access for 20 minutes, as well as a free drink. I‚Äôd recommend buying online using your card, or with Kc at the entrance. Extra drinks can be bought inside for 150 Kc. The place is quite small, although there are three or four areas that are perfect for a good photo op. My recommendation? Brave the cold for a second and take off your jacket for a hilariously out of place photo. Enjoy your time there!

reviews.text: I booked the icepub online for 6 people on 6 March 2018...money came out of bank the day after booking. I have since sent 2 emails to 2 different addresses, put a message on the website and sent a message on Facebook with proof of payment and copy of note on the entrance door ....NOT ONE REPLY!!!....this is disgraceful customer service...if any of the management team are reading this please find my messages and return my payment for something I have not received...thank you

reviews.name: Paul R.
reviews.text:
I even think 3 stars are far too many..
I mean they advertise as it is a big pub with lots of people partying and having fun but it isn't... I was very disappointed, I rather visited something else with that money.
Quite expensive as well for what they offer in exchange, shameful.
So there is how it was:
Hard to find but everything is hard to find in Czech Republic.
After a 20 minutes walk back and forth I did find it.
I paid the entrance I think it was 250 Czech krones.
They gave me a pocker chip ( a tener haha) 
Anyway, I waited excited to enter the pub and a couple came as well, so 3 of us + bartender.
When you wait you have a nice feeling, the music is good, you just can't wait to go inside.. and then you do. They give you a thermal jacket and gloves and you enter.. And here everything you think it was crushes.
The bartender is telling you a story about the pub and then to move to the bar, you can chose between a cocktail ( a shot of vodka or gin if I remember correctly and a mixer on top in glass of ice or a small bottle of beer)
He is telling you to drink it fast and crash the glass of ice ( that I did enjoyed very much hhaha) and then he ask you what do you want next? This time you need to pay for your drink.. 150 krones. First one was included. I sayd Maybe next time hahah. Though the staff was very friendly, we had a long chat while inside. 
And yes, me and another 2 people had fun in an tiny ice bar :) 
You can stay up 20 or 30 minutes inside but usually people stay 10-15 minutes, we stayed till the end. We paid for it didn't we? :) 
Don't understand me wrong, it was impressive indeed but the advertisement make you think it is something different. 
If you go DON'T GO ALONE, take your friends with you or wait for more people to join it would be a much better experience 
And we visited around 3-6 pm in Wednesday or Thursday . The time is important too hahaha. 
Enjoy! üòé

reviews.text:
Looked Awesome but not more. 

You only get 20 Minutes of visit time (the stuff didn't told us that before). 
Only three (3!) Cocktails availible. (Wodka + something) either sweet, sour or bitter. Nothing else. And nothing special. You can do the same at home. 

Entry Price of ~8‚Ç¨ (200 Crowns) heavily overpriced. Was our "lets waste money once" Event. 

And the Room itself is also nothing special. Two small areas with an Ice Thrown. Some Fruits and other things in the Ice. 

One Photographer who takes photos you can buy 2 for another 200 Crowns (EXPENSIVE). 

Overall: Not an "IcePub" but "pay 8‚Ç¨ to stay 20 minutes in an decorated room in ice with one normal cocktail" or just "Tourist baited". 

Would not recommend or visit again.

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) The Blue Bay on Livadhi Beach is a very good restaurant. The staff is friendly. The waiter was in the long order procedure my wife did not show. Our meal was excellent. We had a mixed seafood plate, a plate of noodles with prawns and a Greek salad. The price was for German conditions really cheap (the equivalent of about 28 ‚Ç¨ for food and a round of drinks). A star I have to deduct because the chairs were uncomfortable in the long run and there were no cocktails. But that is whining at a high level.

(Original)
Das Blue Bay am Livadhi Beach ist ein sehr gutes Restaurant. Das Personal ist freundlich. Der Kellner hat sich bei der langen Bestellprozedur meiner Frau nichts anmerken lassen. Unser Essen war ausgezeichnet. Wir hatten eine gemischte Meeresfr√ºchteplatte, einen Teller Nudeln mit Garnelen und dazu einen griechischen Salat. Der Preis war f√ºr deutsche Verh√§ltnisse wirklich g√ºnstig (umgerechnet ca. 28‚Ç¨ f√ºr Essen und eine Runde Getr√§nke). Ok qe keni rregullat tuaja, por ne varesi te klientit dhe situates behen perjashtime. Heres tjeter do porosisim Moet qe te na respektoni.

reviews.name: Edo Berton
reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Walking along the promenade of Dhermi looking for a place to dine, I stopped at Havana.
The restaurant is very attractive to the view thanks to the open space highlighted by the absence of a real roof, in the place there is instead a showy roof composed of scrub, almost like umbrellas.
I wanted to taste a typical dish of aubergines and other vegetables, not exactly suitable for those of you who want to stay fit, and a risotto with seafood.
In my opinion the food is average for a restaurant, the added value comes from the tactical position of the restaurant.
The only flaw is the too loud volume of the music that should not "turn off" the conversation.
Recommended for those who want a dinner with friends in a tourist place on the sea of ‚Äã‚ÄãDhermi, prices in the Albanian average.

(Original)
Camminando sul lungomare di Dhermi alla ricerca di un posto dove cenare, mi sono fermato proprio all‚ÄôHavana.
Il ristorante risulta molto attraente alla vista grazie all‚Äôopen space risaltato dall‚Äôassenza di un vero e proprio tetto, al cui posto vi √® invece un vistoso tetto composto da sterpaglie, quasi come gli ombrelloni.
Io ho voluto assaggiare un tipico piatto di melanzane ed altre verdure, non esattamente adatto a quelli di voi che vogliono rimanere fit, e un risotto ai frutti di mare.
A mio parere il cibo √® nella media per un ristorante, il valore aggiunto viene dalla posizione tattica del ristorante.
Unica pecca il volume troppo alto della musica che non dovrebbe ‚Äúspegnere‚Äù la conversazione.
Consigliato a chi vuole una cena in compagnia in un locale turistico sul mare di Dhermi, prezzi comunque nella media albanese.

reviews.name: Henri Isufllari
reviews.text: A classic coffee by day, restaurant/bar by night place, with a great selection of hot and cold coffees, ice cream, local and international beer and wine, and a very prompt and polite service. The thing I  enjoyed the most was seeing the fish I ordered for lunch delivered fresh an hour before!!! This place also has a stable wifi signal, which comes in handy for those work video conferences scheduled in the middle of your beach time. Unlike the crowded and loud establishments a few hundred meters down, this place also enjoys an undistracted view of the beach.

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) 1:15 pm: we order pizza, pasta and orange juice (the only fresh juice available)
1:35 pm: pasta and orange juice arrive. The pasta dish, too cooked, is not the one we ordered. This one is more expensive and we are told that the one ordered is not available.
1:45 pm: the pizza arrives. The salt cellar had to fall into the dough inadvertently.
2:20 pm: we ask for the bill.
2:25 pm: the addition displays: the pasta dish and pizza requested and a "fresh juice". Then add 3 more than 300 leks justified as follows: 200 leks for the pasta dish not asked that we were served in place of the one ordered. 100 leks for the orange juice that has been decreed more expensive than other juices but whose name is not available on their machine.

This place does soups and sandwiches so dang well! It is on the go so don't really expect to sit down and eat but that's ok since the food is served for eating while walking, biking, skipping... swimming, rock climbing, running from the cops, or general waywardness.

Try to match a soup that complements yours sandwich so when you dip it in the soup it creates a new flavor profile. I mean if your not eating a sandwich this way then why even bother?

reviews.name: Kiel Dancor
reviews.text:
Wow what can i say. This place left me speechless on how good their food is and value for money. We got the angry bird and toki baguette along with 2 chicken ragoo soups. 

All 3 of the different menu items definetly stand on their own merits but in combo were excellent.

The way they serve their soup is ingenius, using large take away coffee cups and a cover if requested with a spoon inserted. Their soups can be chunky and a range of other condiments.
They have a good range of soups which change. 

I liken this soup experience to what i imagined how eating soup seen in seinfeld in the soup N@zi episode and i am newman running down the street with a pot to get more soup.

I am so glad we stumbled upon this place and it being so packed kind of spoke for itself.

Wish I could stay longer to try their soups...

reviews.name: Ankit Sanghi
reviews.text: The food here is very very good. The soups are warm and hearty on a cold day, and their sandwiches are really tasty as well. The variety in food is amazing. The Angry Bird Baguette was definitely the best one out of the ones we had. Among the soups, the pumpkin soup was very tasty. The best part was the enthusiasm and energy that the chefs had. Every time they got a new order, they would shout out, which made the experience of waiting for food more exciting. It can be very busy sometimes so make sure you come a little early!

They're always full of fighting.
The pulled pork, USA, and angry bird BAGUETTE are famous for their own.

They have two size baguette, it's small and normal.
small size baguette looks so small, but that's enough for me.

If you visit here for the first time, so you don't know about their menu, you can order weekly offer baguette or ask something to advise to the staff.

Maybe the staff recommend pulled pork baguette to you. the price of it is 850 HUF.

reviews.name: Francisco Jos√© Arroyo Calzada
reviews.text:
Fantastic place to buy your meal!
It is a pity the place is not bigger to have some tables and enjoy the soups or the pasta. There is a shelf to eat on the run.
But the food? It is great, well prepared  abd really tasty. We had some days in a flat very close to this place and bought the food several times.
Staff is really nice and helpful.
Pasta is tasty, baguettes are giid (specially the french lady), but soups are the queens. No matter what you choose, you will win. They explained us that they change them weekly, because there are a lot of people getting their meals there and they want to offer them different choices.
Probably is one of the gastro places in the city that shouldn't be missed.

reviews.name: Jung-won Lee
reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Drunk in a very hip mood, sitting across the truck in front of the store. The main sandwich is made from a combination of bbq chicken, vegetables and sauces wrapped with world-famous cheese, and a combination of baguettes with a surprisingly soft texture, but the taste is similar to burrito. In fact, the lack HOT hagien only sandwiches, but now, where you want to enter the taste of cheonsanggye should just eat as chicken soup. It's tomato-based, so it's a bit of a Western taste, and it's more dense than any other famous soup restaurant. Moreover, thanks to the crumbs that can't be reduced no matter how much you eat it, you won't be able to discuss the cost ratio. And with more hospitality than the grandmother's grandmother, she completed five stars.

reviews.name: Oszkar
reviews.text:
Great standing restaurant at the heart of the food and craft beer district. Doesn't have a distinct cuisine, I'd call it creative new wave street food. I'd say it's a must for any foodie that visits Budapest.
Unfortunately they only accept cash so prepare for that. But that's probably the only negative.

reviews.name: Shawn Blum
reviews.text: Some of the best food I've had in my life. Its street food, but the recipes are made by a Michelin Star Chef. Absolutely mindblowing, I have never been disappointed coming here. The prices are extremely good for the quality of food you get. The staff are very friendly, if you are in Budapest, this place is a must. It's an experience that everyone should have when here.

Definitely a must if you are in Budapest!

Da ammirare soprattutto l'originalissima idea imprenditoriale e lo stile del locale. Simpaticissimo il personale.

reviews.name: Aljona
reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) An inconspicuous shop in front of which is constantly forming a queue, so we have discovered this place and asked ourselves, what can there be so delicious: sandwiches & soup, sounds at first not so super promising to queue up. But today we are down, and what can we say, the soup, we had the vegetarian version of the pepper soup with roasted onions and feta as a deposit, was mega! Tasty top even if for our conditions a bit too cold.

Fairly priced and actually too cheap when comparing the prices with the nearby street food market. The guys behind the counter are friendly, do their job with love and also help with the selection in English. Since it is usually full, you must either eat the soup quickly at one of the bar tables or take it with you.
 
Vegetarians are also thought here. There are three soups to choose from, a sandwich and certainly more, but the rest of the menu was in Hungarian.

We loved it and come back the days to try one of the sandwiches.

(Original)
Ein unscheinbares L√§dchen vor dem sich st√§ndig eine Schlange bildet, so haben wir dieses Lokal entdeckt und uns gefragt, was kann es dort so leckeres geben: Sandwiche & Suppe, klingt im ersten Moment nicht so super viel versprechend um sich in der Schlange anzustellen. Heute sind wir aber doch mal hin, und was soll man sagen, die Suppe, wir hatten die vegetarische Variante der Paprikasuppe mit ger√∂steten Zwiebeln und Feta als Einlage, war mega! Geschmacklich top auch wenn f√ºr unsere Verh√§ltnisse schon etwas zu kalt. 

Preislich fair und eigentlich zu g√ºnstig, wenn man die Preise mit den Streetfood Market in der N√§he vergleicht. Die Jungs hinter der Theke sind freundlich, machen ihren Job mit Liebe und helfen auch bei der Auswahl in Englisch. Da es meist voll ist, muss man die Suppe entweder schnell an einem der Stehtische essen oder mitnehmen.

Auch an Vegetarier wird hier hier gedacht. Es gibt drei Suppen zur Auswahl, einen Sandwich und sicherlich noch mehr, aber der Rest der Karte war auf ungarisch.

Wir waren begeistert und kommen die Tage wieder um eines der Sandwiche zu testen.

(Translated by Google) Bors Gastro Bar in Kazinczy street in Budapest: you can enjoy a really tasty sandwich at reasonable prices & good quality. Meat in my pulled pork was tender, slow-cooked and I also liked the crispy baguette. Plus, you are surrounded by Star Wars memorabilia. When you make an order, the guy at the counter asks about your name so that they can call you by name, once your order is ready. Little thing makes a big difference! Good job guys, May the Bors be with You! Thanks
 
Bors Gastro Bar at Kazinczy tu: really delicious sandwiches (and soups) in good quality and at an affordable price. The meat in my pulled pork was delicate and really prepared slow-cooked, crunchy baguette, red cabbage and gouda cheese. When you order, the staff will write down your name so that they can then call you when the food is ready. Little, but pleased, just like the characters from Star Wars, who got quite a lot. In the beginning, the boys had two, but they gradually wore more.

reviews.name: Isaac Specter
reviews.text: Visiting Bors GasztroB√°r was one of my most memorable experiences of my trip to Budapest, and there was plenty of competition for that title. When I first entered, I was greeted with enthusiasm from the guys working, the smells of delicious food, and a completely overwhelming menu. After discussion with the guy taking my order, I settled on the special sandwich and their homemade apple basil soda. The soda was a fantastic choice and I would highly recommend it. The real treat was the sandwich. When I took my first bite, I knew it was a winner. There was so much flavor and the crispness of the baguette was so perfect. I wish I had the appetite to eat three that day. I can‚Äôt wait until my next visit to Budapest. Bors will be my first stop.

reviews.name: Robert Farkas
reviews.text:
Pros: 
Awesome place, for 4.80‚Ç¨ u get a sup in a cup + a long, toasted baguette filled with really tasty good stuff. Oh yeah, try the lentil-mustard soup...pulled pork  baguette then the Nutella soup for dessert. :) Not many ppl mention, that they also have vegan stuff, healthy salads, different pasta versions and desserts. The guys are easy going and they speak English.
Cons:  
Cash (HUF) only. No toilet. Small. Crowded. There is a chance that U gonna eat standing, like a horse.:) But it's a bloody good STREET FOOD mate. 

Seriously, just give it a go mate, it's worth it!
Btw. Don't go there during peak hours or you will be standing in the line for a long time...and check out their Facebook page, cos sometimes they make specials that's not on the menu, and u gotta ask for it.

This is the best fast-food place in the city, probably in the world :)
They sell soups and sandwiches. The soup menu changes daily and varies from new takes on classics to extremely creative and unique creations. They even sell "dessert" soups.
The sandwiches are also high quality an creative, you'll want to try all of them.
The staff is very friendly and effective and they speak good english.
The only bad thing I could say that this is a street-food place, meaning you'll probably eat on the street, since 90% of the time their tiny place is jam packed.

reviews.name: Sudhaamshu MS
reviews.text:
I swung by the place with my luggage, just before I left Budapest. Ordered the Barack Obama, and was recommended the Thai soup with it. Both were absolutely delicious!

Being my last hour in the city, I was short on HUF. So I offered a ‚Ç¨20 note. Any normal place would have returned my change in HUF, but not these guys. Seeing my luggage, he realized the HUF isn't of much use to me. He offered to not charge me for my meal, and instead only asked to go recommend the place to all my friends who would bring them more business. I was blown away by this sweet gesture. Eventually I gathered all my available loose change in EUR and HUF and dropped it into their tip jar.

The guys won me over with this simple gesture. I am definitely coming back to Budapest to eat here multiple times. Love you guys. IGEN!

Will return!

reviews.text:
This place might be small and it can make you feel a bit claustrophobic while you are waiting BUT, listen, this is a "badass" spot. They have made soups of everything you can imagine, even Nutella soup! Service is nice and as fast as they can manage for a super popular place, I never wait too long and when I order a soup and sandwich, I get my soup first and very quickly, so I can enjoy while I wait for my sandwich. 
My warning, once you go there, if you live in Budapest, you cannot stop going, you will crave it, and if you study at the Faculty of ELTE in Kazinczy street, you will end up ordering your soup during the breaks. 
This is gourmet-quality, but in a glass and with a super price!

reviews.name: Henry Zhu

It's also really well priced, I paid about $5 USD for an entire meal. The cooks and workers at Bors are amazingly awesome! They REALLY love what they do, which is have fun and make awesome sandwiches for YOU! They're always so helpful and happy. My favorite sandwich is T√∂ki pomp√°s! The green herb, tomato sauce, and cheese is just as good! GO NOW!!
